Pre-Game Insights: France is hoping to recover in front of their native supporters after losing to Spain in the semi-finals of Euro 2024.
Italy is keen to bounce back from a dismal Euro 2024 performance whereby Switzerland eliminated them in the Round of 16.
Both teams are under pressure to perform after disappointing campaigns in recent tournaments.
France may have a psychological advantage going into this game, particularly with the support of their home crowd at Parc des Princes.
Italy’s tactical flexibility and solid past performance in demanding games should not be ignored.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match marks the League A, Round 1 start of the UEFA Nations League.
Sandro Scharer from Switzerland will be the referee for this game.
The Parc des Princes is expected to be packed with fervent supporters ready to see these teams carry on their age-old rivalry.
Injuries, suspensions, or other circumstances will make several important players from both teams absent for this game.
France tends to perform exceptionally well when playing at home, as evidenced by their recent competitive fixtures.
Others: France’s recent form shows a mixture of wins, draws, and losses.
Italy’s latest performances have been disappointing, with just two victories in their last five games.
The historical data shows a slight edge for France in recent encounters, having won three out of the last five matches.
Italy’s shift to a back three under Luciano Spalletti could impact their defensive solidity.
Didier Deschamps and Luciano Spalletti are both experienced managers with distinct tactical approaches.
